Notes.Text:
This update for python-cryptography fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2018-10903: The finalize_with_tag API did not enforce a minimum tag
  length. If a user did not validate the input length prior to passing it to
  finalize_with_tag an attacker could craft an invalid payload with a shortened
  tag (e.g. 1 byte) such that they would have a 1 in 256 chance of passing the
  MAC check. GCM tag forgeries could have caused key leakage (bsc#1101820).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Basesystem 15
SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Basesystem 15

Vulnerabilities.Description: A flaw was found in python-cryptography versions between >=1.9.0 and <2.3. The finalize_with_tag API did not enforce a minimum tag length. If a user did not validate the input length prior to passing it to finalize_with_tag an attacker could craft an invalid payload with a shortened tag (e.g. 1 byte) such that they would have a 1 in 256 chance of passing the MAC check. GCM tag forgeries can cause key leakage.
